The plot is simple: a group of high school friends are invited to the prom by one of their classmates for a night of dancing. They meet up with some friends, get drunk and have a bit of fun. It all comes to a head when the main character, played by Kevin Spacey, falls in love with a girl named Jennifer. The only thing that happens is that Jennifer ends up having an affair with Spaceys brother-in-law, who just happens to be the one who cheated on them. So, they go back to their dorm room to try and figure out what's going on. Unfortunately, things go wrong when Jennifer's boyfriend doesn't let them know about it until later in the film, when he finds out that Spaceies girlfriend is cheating on him and tries to blackmail him into having sex with her. Needless to say, this leads to Spaceie and Jennifer getting hit by cars and eventually falling in bed with each other.

Don't get me wrong, I'm a big fan of Jodie Foster, but when she made this movie, she wasn't funny at all. She just looked like she was playing a girl. And that's about it. The acting is good, the writing is decent, and the special effects are pretty good. But the best thing about this film is that it takes itself seriously. I don't know what else to say about the film, except that if you're looking for a laugh out of a bad movie (like this one), you should definitely check it out.

.... <brief description of the film's plot]<besides the fact that it is set in England, the rest of this movie is just a bunch of random people wandering around town looking for a place to stay. It turns out that there is a man with whom they are going to meet, but the guy doesn't know where he is, so they decide to go on a date. When they arrive at the location, it turns into a huge house full of dead bodies. This leads to a lot of confusion as to who the real killer is and why he was there.<spoiler]In conclusion, this is one of those movies that you can sit through and have fun with. If you like horror films, you'll love this one. But if you don't, then you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend this film to anyone who loves scary movies.
